Description: Body sherd of Clazomenian black-figured pottery amphora, possibly a neck-amphora; exterior: part of black handle zone to left of black-figure decoration consisting of draped youth or young man (with added red on hair) standing to right.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 120, no. 339.2, pl. XXXVII)
Cook 1952 / A List of Clazomenian Pottery (p. 135, d)
Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 232, no. 174)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.122) (phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5739 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
